title.native: 自動販売機に生まれ変わった俺は迷宮を彷徨う
title.romaji: Jidou Hanbaiki ni Umarekawatta Ore wa Meikyuu wo Samayou
title.english: Reborn as a Vending Machine, I Now Wander the Dungeon

description:
The future of this fantasy world now lies in the hands of…a vending machine! Boxxo was once a human, until he died in an accident and was reincarnated as a sentient piece of machinery. While he can still hear and see, there’s no way for him to move by himself or speak more than his programmed phrases. How can he make the most of this strange new life?

(Source: Crunchyroll)
hashtag: #俺自販機 #自動販売機に生まれ変わった俺は迷宮を彷徨う
synonyms: Переродившись в торговый автомат, я блуждаю по подземелью
自動販売機に生まれ変わった俺は迷宮を彷徨う
Jidōhanbaiki ni Umarekawatta Ore wa Meikyū ni Samayō
Reencarnado numa Máquina de Vendas, Agora Exploro a Masmorra

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Dungeon
tags.description: Prominently features a dungeon environment.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Economics
tags.description: Centers around the field of economics.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

node.description: Started off as a composite artist.

Former adult game scenario writer. He is a creator of cult classic Shizuku, Kizuato and To Heart.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_takahasi)

__[Website](http://bradio.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/BRADIO_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bradio_official/)__

__Founded:__ 2010
__Genres:__ Funk-rock, disco, soul
__Origin:__ Japan

__Introduction:__
BRADIO is a Japanse funk-rock band under record label Warner Music Japan (2017-), while having previously been under D&S Records (2013-2014) and Hero Music Entertainment (2014-2017). Their name is an acronym for "__B__reak the __R__ule __A__nd __D__o __I__mage __O__n", meaning that they will break the rules of everyday life, while having a wonderful image all around, and with this they will make a good place. The band calls their fans for Funky Party People (FPP)

__Biography:__
In 2010, The Movie Archives' Takaaki Shingyoji and Yuki Tanabe formed BRADIO with Soichi Ohyama (ex-Gold End), Ryosuke Sakai (ex-Gold End), and Takahiro Kitazawa (ex-Awesome Dude). That same year in December, they released their first demo and played in their first live concert. In April 2012, they released their second demo. In June 2012, Takahiro left the band and they were left with the current line up.

They signed with D&S Records and released their first mini album, _Diamond Pops_, in October 2013. Bradio released their second mini-album, _Swipe Times_, in July 2014 under Hero Music Entertainment. Their first single "Otona Hit Parade/Step In Time" was released in November 2014. At the beginning of 2015, their single, "Flyers", was used as the opening theme song for the anime _[Death Parade](https://anilist.co/anime/20931/Death-Parade/)_.

On June 3, 2015, Bradio released their first full-length album, _Power of Life_. Their single "Hotel Alien", released on November 11, 2015, was used as the opening of the anime _[Peeping Life Season 1](https://anilist.co/anime/21347/Peeping-Life-TV-Season-1/)_.

Their first ballad single "Gift" was released on June 1, 2016. The single is used to expressed how to say thank you for all children to their mothers. The second track, "Bring it on", is used in the Square Enix game _Rungun-Cannonball_ for smartphones.

Their single "Back to the Funk" was released on November 11, 2016. Their second album, _Freedom_, was released on January 18, 2017.

Their first major single "La pa Paradise" was released on October 11, 2017. This single is the first major single after they moved to the Warner Music Japan label.

On January 15, 2018, Bradio announced on their website, that drummer Tanabe Yuki (田邊有希) will leave the band.

Bradio performed internationally for the first time at A-Kon 2018 in Fort Worth, Texas. They returned to the United States to perform at Otakon in Washington, D.C. on July 24, 2018.

__Members:__
- [Shingyouji Takaaki (真行寺貴秋)](https://anilist.co/staff/152594/Takaaki-Shingyouji) — lead-vocal (2010-)
- Ohyama Soichi (大山聡一) — guitar, vocals (2010–)
- Sakai Ryosuke (酒井亮輔) — bass, vocals (2010–)

__Former Members:__
- Kitazawa Takahiro (北澤雄大) — guitar (2010–2012)
- Tanabe Yuki (田邊有希) — drums, vocals (2010–2018)

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BRADIO)

[Blog](http://halfawake.blog.shinobi.jp/%E8%87%AA%E5%B7%B1%E7%B4%B9%E4%BB%8B/%E7%81%AF%E5%A4%A2) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LlittleTomBoy) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/halfawakerobotman/)

Tom is a Japanese composite artist and designer affiliated with company [Digital Noise](https://d-noise.co.jp/).
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/133009/)._

[Website](http://www.yutaull.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuta_ul41916) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuta_ul)

Born in 1996. Iwata city, Shizuoka prefecture. He graduated from Shizuoka Prefectural Iwata Minami High School. He has studied at the Kunitachi College of Music and majors in computer music. He studied composition with Kiyoshi Furukawa, Shohei Shimizu, Kazunori Maruyama and Takayuki Rai. While studying at university, he acted as a composer for commercial songs and theater-accompanying music. Besides these activities, he has composed electronic music and minimal music.

__[Website](http://bradio.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/BRADIO_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bradio_official/)__
